test_texts: Metformin reduces blood glucose levels in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
Ibuprofen can cause gastric ulcers and gastrointestinal bleeding complications.
The p53 tumor suppressor gene is frequently mutated in human cancers.
ACE inhibitors like lisinopril are first-line therapy for hypertension.
Warfarin is an anticoagulant that requires regular INR monitoring.
Aspirin therapy reduces cardiovascular risk in diabetic patients.
Statins such as atorvastatin lower cholesterol and prevent heart disease.
Insulin resistance is a key feature of type 2 diabetes pathophysiology.
BRCA1 mutations increase breast cancer susceptibility in women.
NSAIDs can cause nephrotoxicity and acute kidney injury.
